mods.abstract: Runaway FROM the plantation of the subscriber, on Red River, opposite Shreveport, on Saturday, 12th inst., a negro man by the named of Smith, about 6 feet high, black complexion, prominent eyes and well muscled, and between 28 or 30 years old. He took away with him a brown or mouse colored Mule. He will probably attempt to make his way out west, for the purpose of getting with the Indians. A liberal reward will be paid for his apprehension and delivery on my plantation, or for his being lodged in any safe jail so that I can get him again. M.D.C. ALEXANDER. aug 16 The Jefferson Herald, and Austin Gazette will copy three times, and forward their bills to this office.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
